@@7543233 <h> Nothing is modest ... loose jeans <h> share <h> Loose jeans <p> WAMBUI MURIITHI <p> Every now and then , I meet or see a girl wearing loose jeans . By loose I do n't mean that the crotch is sagging around her knees . I mean that there are places on her hips , a** and upper legs where the fabric is not touching her skin . I suspect that they do this for one of three reasons : <p> One , they think their figure is n't attractive enough to wear tight jeans . Two , they think that tight jeans are immodest . And three , they do n't care about their appearance and loose jeans are more comfortable . I realise I wo n't convince the last group of anything , so I am only going to address group one and two . <p> Let 's start with group one ... No matter how fat you are , or how badly you are shaped , loose jeans do not hide it . In fact , they make it look worse . Tight jeans might not make your behind or legs look good , but loose jeans will make you @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ will do nothing for your appearance if your trousers are ill-fitting . As for the group concerned with modesty , you need a reality check . Tight jeans are not provocative ; they are normal . <p> Despite what you were raised to believe , modesty is not something objective . What looks appropriate , or ' slutty ' or conservative changes significantly depending on context and social norms . If you were to go to work in a skirt the length of a belt , or better yet walk down Moi Avenue in a bikini , it would shock people and look slutty . But in a nightclub , or on the beach , they are not only normal , but expected . They do n't look slutty at all . This is what I mean by context . <p> Perhaps more importantly , when you use your clothes rather than your behaviour to be modest , you are far more similar than you think to the girls who use their clothes rather than their behaviour to get sexual attention . If you 're worried about Team Mafisi , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ kind of attention , it just makes you look terrible . 
@@7543234 <h> My fianc ? ... 's tribe is my parents ' no-go zone <h> share <p> I 'm in love with a woman from a different tribe . We have been going out for two years , but I have n't introduced her to my parents . This is because my parents once told me never to date someone from her tribe . <p> My dad said that none of his sons should date a woman from that tribe . But I love this woman so much and she loves me too . We are planning to marry next year , but my fear is , what if my parents are adamant that I should n't marry her ? What should I do ? Please advice . <p> OUR TAKE <p> Love knows no boundaries and one can fall in love with somebody irrespective of their colour , creed or culture . But we stereoptype people based on their tribes , or where they come from . <p> It is these stereotypes that sometimes make us fear certain tribes or cultures . Whereas those stereotypes may be true to some extent , in relating with people as individuals , we may come to disapprove @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , that love will cover a multitude of sins . <p> Prepare yourselves <p> What then is important for you and your fiance is to brace yourselves and your fianc ? e for the battle ahead . Let her know what to expect , but she should n't take it personally . She is going to need a lot of support and reassurance from you . <p> Approach this together as a team . As for your parents , prepare them for this by throwing a few hints here and there about the person you want to marry . If you have a relative or a family friend who is open to cross cultural marriages , use them as a bridge to your parents . <p> Bite the bullet <p> After preparing the ground work , bite the bullet and take her home to your parents . Do n't be surprised if your parents oppose your decision . Understand their position even as you stick to yours . Whatever happens , try as much as possible to still honour and love your parents even though you do n't agree . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , they will be left with no option , but to accept her . <p> Move on <p> Even if they refuse to accept her , nothing should hold you back as there is nowhere in the law where parents consent is required for a marriage . Realise that you are old enough to make your own decisions . So , move on with your plans . Make sure they know you 're happy . <p> Your parents may not understand why you love her so much . Tell them about thoughtful little things she does , and give them a chance to see how happy you are when you 're with her . When they see the other side of her , that is , her personality and character , not her tribe , they might learn to like her and realise you have excellent taste .

Allan Katerega . <p> Gor , who are yet to win a match this season , could have taken an early lead in the second minute when Ugandan Godfrey Walusimbi tore the left to curl home a goal bound cross , but Leopards keeper Lukas Indeche produced a man of the match performance with a top drawer save . <p> Leopards responded immediately with a counter-attack that was started by Miheso on the right to find Wekesa , who did well to trouble Gor 's defence , forcing Ochieng to bring the teenager down at the edge of the box but referee Anthony Ogwayo waved play on . <p> Gor made all the early running and Indeche was forced to save twice from wasteful Innocent Wafula . <p> The shot-stopper , first parried Wafula 's low drive in the 12th minute to deny George ' Blackberry ' Odhiambo , who was eagerly waiting to tap home . <p> Wafula managed to go past two defenders a minute later , but his finishing was poor as Indeche easily picked the feeble shot . <p> @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ limped off injured to be replaced with Katerega . <p> Leopards improved to gain confidence in the midfield thanks to Katerega 's pace that saw him give Ingwe the first shot on target with a long range effort to wake up Gor custodian Onyango , who warded off the cracker . <p> Wafula squandered his last opportunity on the stroke of half-time when Odhiambo put him through but the winger was slow to respond to allow Indeche came off his line to rescue Leopards . <p> Both sides resulted to a physical game in the second half but it was Gor who threatened first through Odhiambo , who pulled a ferocious strike , demanding Indeche 's save to keep Ingwe in the tensed match . <p> Against the run of play , Leopards utilised Gor 's slackness at the back to see Miheso provide the inviting cross that found Diallo , who ran at the defence before tapping narrowly wide on the far right corner . <p> The visitors opted for counter-attacking with Katerega unleashing a lethal shot that called Onyango into action , @@7543238 cop <h> share <h> Bright Gameli Mawudor <p> BRIGHT GAMELI is not your usual techie . He is a martial art lover and a basketball fanatic <p> Bright Gameli Mawudor was drawn to the world of technology when he was just seven . <p> Gameli , the only son in a family of four , was introduced to the techspace by his father , Dr Bright Mawudor Senior after he noticed his son 's budding interest . <p> " When I saw a computer for the first time , I fell in love with it . My dad introduced me to the MS-DOS 6 and from that moment I just learnt through practice , ' ' he recalls . Gameli , 28 , had an easy time grasping concepts because of his keen interest . <p> " I was enrolled for a basic computer course , but somewhere in the middle I got bored , when my exams came I aced it.That became my first and last computer school . I had already created my own computer virus at the age of 10 . I was just playing around with the computer and ended up creating a piece of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ system , ' ' says Gameli , the Co-Founder of AfricaHackon . <p> In 2002 , his family moved to Kenya from Ghana after his father was deployed as Deputy General Secretary of All Africa Conference of Churches . At 14 while at St Mary 's School in Lavington , he created his second virus while pursuing an International Baccalaureate . His friends and family were a little shaken by his pace , though to his defence he says he was largely a normal child . <p> " I tried to have a social life through playing basketball and of course family time was paramount , ' ' he offers . Come 2007 , he got a slot at Daystar University to pursue Applied Computer Science where on the sides he did a certificate in ethical hacking . Such was his passion that by his third year at campus he had already secured jobs in the networking , systems solutions and cyber security areas . <p> Some of the people he holds in high regard were the ones who mentored him in the industry . Tyrus Kamau , Cellutant CEO @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " After graduation in June 2011 , Kamau got hold of me after I dropped off my CV and I was hired after three days . <p> He is a shrewd teacher and I learnt a lot under his tutelage , I appreciate the way he took a chance on me , ' ' he reminisces . Gameli a martial arts lover worked for only 20 months before jetting off to Pukyong National University , South Korea for a second degree in 2012 with a focus thesis on Cyber Security . <p> " While there my urge grew and I developed a model for banks to structure their in-house security platform , " he says . Surprisingly he was short of confidence while growing up because he was stuttering , but the influence of his parents and older siblings helped him get over it . <p> He is now pursuing his Doctorate in IT Convergence and Application Engineering in Busan where he also practises as an Online Security Consultant . <p> Gameli is happy because his influence in the technology community has imparted knowledge to hundreds of young people . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ think Africa is on a good path . We need to invest more on cyber security because currently Kenya , for example , is amongst the top 10 countries in the world under extreme cyber threats , ' ' he avers.

@@7719230 <p> Investigators have told ... Nairobi court that Governor Evans Kidero 's bank accounts had large cash deposits suspected to be proceeds of corruption . <p> The Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission ( EACC ) Investigation Officer , Mulki Umar , said the evidence uncovered aroused reasonable suspicion that the governor was involved in corrupt conduct . <p> " Upon the analysis of the said bank account , it was noted that between January 27 , 2011 and December 31 , 2015 , Dr Kidero received a cash deposit of Sh317,116,000 , " detective Umar told the court yesterday . <p> The Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission ( EACC ) told the High Court that " the bank statement reflected large cash deposits on a regular basis quite characteristic of money laundering " . <p> EACC investigating officer Mulki Abdi Umar explained that following evidence that provided reasonable suspicion that the governor was involved in corrupt conduct and economic crimes , she obtained a court order on January 19 from Makadara Chief Magistrate 's Court to investigate the accounts . <p> " Upon the analysis of the said bank account , it was noted that between January 27 , 2011 and December 31 , 2015 , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Sh317,116,000 in cash deposits alone , " said Umar in a replying affidavit dated March 14 . <p> The account also reflected a sum of Sh200 million , equivalent to slightly over US$2 million at the prevailing exchange rate , which was deposited in a fixed deposit account . <p> Umar said it was evident from the account transactions that the petitioner could easily afford the money equivalent to the bribe he is alleged to have given . Kidero is accused of giving a Sh200 million bribe to Supreme Court Judge Philip Tunoi to influence the decision of an election petition filed against him by Kabete MP Ferdinard Waititu . A tribunal is set to investigate the veracity of the claims . <p> Besides , the account reflects other funds invested in fixed deposit accounts . Umar added that the transactions in the account led to discovery of other accounts associated with Kidero . <p> The detective said it was on the strength of that information that the commission sought and obtained a warrant to investigate Kidero 's accounts . Umar said it was the mandate of EACC to conduct @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ EACC wanted to establish the truth on whether there was a money trail and movements of the funds , " said Umar .

President Uhuru Kenyatta and his deputy William Ruto told Kenyans the SGR project would revolutionise the transport sector and provide the country with the momentum for economic take-off . <p> Another project was the Sh55 billion Greenfield project that was to significantly expand the country 's largest airport . And the Sh14 billion Galana Kulalu project was to place one million acres of land under irrigation . <p> " We know that we have created the right team to not only make Kenya 's Vision 2030 a reality , but also deliver accelerated economic growth , higher living standards and more jobs . Most importantly , the coalition is dedicated to radically address the inexcusable poverty and inequality that exist in our country today . By building industries here at home , we can create the kind of economy that will generate five million new jobs over the next five years , " the President said in February 2013 . <p> But three years on , analysts are divided on whether Kenyans have more money in their pockets than they had three years ago . <p> " Under @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ developments include SGR , sea port and airport expansion and energy output increase , " said Senate Finance committee Chair Billow Kerrow . <p> While the SGR project is on course , its implementation was bedevilled by hiccups , including allegations of corruption in the awarding of the construction tender . <p> But if the project proceeds on schedule , it could be Jubilee 's poster case in the 2017 elections . <p> However , the project is not without critics . The SGR project is one of the biggest scandals ever witnessed in Kenya and 2017 will be the right time to send the Jubilee administration packing as proper investigations and prosecution follow . From now you will not have to import clothes anymore . They have been brought closer to you , " said Ranguma . <p> The project is expected to open-up more opportunities of employment @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and women . <p> Governor Ranguma said plans to revive cotton growing in Kisumu to support the project is underway , with residents set to benefit from subsidised hybrid cotton seeds alongside other incentives to kick-start the process so as to provide steady supply of raw material to the facility . <p> " We have the ability to produce enough cotton to dress the entire country and this opportunity has presented itself here for us to utilise the ability . I fully support it and will do all I can to see that our people benefit the most from this project , " he added .

Ignite Kenya Youth Night Market , is a joint initiative of the Nairobi County Government and the Youth Agenda , a non-governmental organisation . <p> The youth will have an opportunity , on select other items . <p> " The night markets are one way of addressing the serious youth unemployment problem which is not unique to Nairobi County but a countrywide challenge , we 're calling on the youth to take up the opportunity to make some extra income , " said the Nairobi County Executive in charge of youth affairs , Ms Anne Lokidor . <p> The Nairobi County Government law enforcement officers will provide security for traders at the KICC 's Comesa grounds starting 4PM and closing at about midnight . <p> Ms Lokidor said the county government has resolved to waive the Ksh 2,500 license fees that would have been payable by the traders , in addition to waiving permits to allow for the distribution of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ County Fires trucks and Ambulance Services to attend to any emergencies . <p> The night market initiative is similar to others such as the Stop Night Market in Ontario , Canada and the Queens Night Market in New York . <p> " They will offer Nairobians who are busy during the day an opportunity to buy clothes and other household goods on their way from work and over the weekend , " said Ms Lokidor , who is also in charge of the ICT , Education and Social Services dockets . <p> The Ignite Kenya Youth Night Market initiative is also supported by the national government through the Ministry of Public Service , Youth and Gender Affairs as well as the Ford Foundation and the Good Neighbours Committee . <p> A recent survey released by the World Bank identified Kenya as having one of the highest youth unemployment rates both globally and even compared to neighbouring countries Uganda and Tanzania . <p> This is the latest partnership that the Nairobi County government has entered to support the creation of youth employment opportunities . <p> Earlier partnership the Nairobi county government will avail its vocational training facilities for successful applicants of the KCB program . <p> Ms Lokidor also noted that City Hall has in the past three years offered hundreds of scholarships to academically gifted high school students from poor households to give them a chance at improving their welfare .

@@7803236 's Monetary Policy Committee meeting <p> The MPC has maintained the CBR at 11.5 percent for the last five consecutive meetings on account of stability in the foreign exchange market . Photo/CFM-FILE . <p> NAIROBI , Kenya , Mar 20- The Central Bank 's Monetary Policy Committee ( MPC ) meeting is expected to take place on Monday with market players keen to see if it will retain its lending rate . <p> The MPC has maintained the CBR at 11.5 percent for the last five consecutive meetings on account of stability in the foreign exchange market , improvement in Forex reserves to about 4.5 months of import cover and a narrowing current account deficit . <p> According to Investments Manager at Cytonn Maurice Oduor there is a possibility the MPC may consider lowering the CBR by 50 bps to 11 percent given the favorable environment and positive factors since the beginning of the year . <p> Since January , the country has experienced a lot starting with the expectations of a high economic growth rate forecast by various institutions like the International Monetary Fund ( IMF ) , as well as the stable forex trade and money markets @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the interest rates are attractive to the economy at the current levels , and would be in line with CBK Governor Patrick Njoroge 's earlier statement that MPC is working towards lowering rates , anchored by a stable currency and inflation rates , " she said . <p> However , she said , that the best move for the economy at this point would be for the MPC to maintain CBR at the current 11.5 for full stability of all the indicators . <p> " This would be the effects of lower interest rates , a stable shilling and low inflationary pressures to consolidate , and the economy to fully be anchored against any shocks in the near term , " she argues . <p> The principle mandate of the MPC is to formulate and implement monetary policy to achieve and maintain price stability in the country and help create a conducive environment for economic growth . <p> Price stability includes inflation levels , currency and interest rates which is achieved through regulating Central Bank Rate ( CBR ) , which is the base for all monetary policy operations . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ shilling , the MPC raises CBR to curb inflationary pressures and stabilise the shilling . <p> A higher CBR makes it more expensive for consumers to borrow to fund consumption and investment expenditure , which reduces liquidity , in turn reducing inflationary pressures . The opposite is true in a low inflation environment . <p> " The decisions of this MPC meeting are going to be key in shaping the monetary policy environment for the remaining part of the fiscal year 2015/16 , " Oduor says . <h> Related ... <p> Margaret has been a business reporter for the past four years . She holds a Bachelors of Science degree in Communications and Public Relations from Moi University . She also holds a diploma in Film and Video production from the Kenya institute of Mass Communications . Apart from journalism , she has interest in community work , especially helping the disadvantaged .

" <p> Mwangi said the place was named for the remembrance of the peace deal which helped sort out the violence . <p> " This place reminds me of the peace maker , even the people who live here coexist peacefully because of its name , " said Mwangi . <p> The former UN Secretary General jetted into the country a midst violence and brought to an end a conflict which left scores dead .

The judge added he had felt mercy , noting the number of years that Mwangi had been in prison had taught him a lesson . Mwangi , according to Mativo , appeared to have been tamed by jail life and was full of remorse . <p> " I note that the minimum sentence provided under the law is five years but can be enhanced to life imprisonment , where there are aggravating circumstances , " said the judge . <p> He added : " I have carefully considered the peculiar facts of this case , the law and the purpose of sentencing as enumerated above and the social status of the appellant as @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Service Officer 's report , which at the time depicted the appellant as a person known to create disturbance to the community and family . And my own assessment after the appellant appeared before me ( for he appeared to be subdued by prison life and remorseful ) and taking all the foregoing into account , I take the view that the interests of justice will be met if I reduce the sentence from 17 years to seven . " <p> Mwangi did not ask the court to set him free , he instead informed it he was willing to spend time in jail but the sentence be reduced .

" <p> She advanced several reasons to bolster her case . On the face of it you would imagine that there is a serious problem with how the Constitution was crafted . But Ms Mbarire does not really provide evidence . <p> At its core , critical thinking entails the ability to gather credible proof to back one 's arguments . Throughout her ruminations , Mbarire does not cite any one piece or article of the Constitution that is a hindrance to the President as she tries to put it . <p> The President , after all does not act alone . Photo/whc.unesco.org <p> Nine Kayas within the Mijikenda tribes in Coast are set to get financial support from Unesco for their activities aimed at enhancing environmental conservation . <p> Kaya Rabai which has been renamed Kaya Mudzi Muvya has been receiving Sh1.5 million annually and is among three other historical sites including Lamu and Fort Jesus , which have been receiving funding from the international organisation . <p> Speaking recently at Kaya Rabai , UNESCO Secretary General Mrs Evangeline Njoka said the organisation was considering supporting the eight other kayas among the Mijikenda communities living in Coast Region of Kenya . <p> She emphasised that communities living within and adjacent to the sites must however show commitment in environmental conservation activities for them to be recognised by the organisation . <p> Other kayas set to benefit from the support are Kaya Fungo , Chonyi , Kambe , Ribe , Kauma , Jibana , Digo and Duruma respectively , located separately @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ support by the organisation will go towards initiating tree nurseries , training of communities living adjacent to the forests on conservation measures and constructing shelters for tourists visiting the sites . <p> Sadly , some of the kayas have been undergoing massive destruction by invaders who have destroyed the forests with the purpose of converting them into farmlands . Notable areas include Kaya Chonyi and Kauma where huge chunks of land have been converted into farmlands . <p> According to officials from Kenya Forest Services ( KFS ) , the severe damages have been due to the lack of registration and titles for the sites as people arrested for the damages are often set free by the courts . <p> According to Kilifi County deputy ecosystem conservator Mr Nasib Mwamutsi , it has been difficult to keep off the communities at bay when they attempt to encroach the forests due to the lack of legal documents to support their evictions . <p> " After sensitisation meetings with the communities on the importance of environmental conservation in the sites , we are seeing positive changes as the communities have recognised the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " said Mwamutsi during a tree planting exercise at Kaya Rabai recently . <p> The chairman of Kaya Mudzi Muvya Mr Daniel Mwawara Garero said a committee charged with the responsibility of caring for the forest has been effective in its work and that several people found cutting trees within the forests have been arrested and taken to court . <p> He said the only challenge facing them was the lack of vehicles to assist in carrying out patrols within the forest boundaries . <p> Garero who is also the chairman of Kilifi County Council of Kaya elders said with the support by UNESCO and Kilifi County Government , a tree nursery has been put in place with over 10 , 000 tree seedlings being nurtured for planting annually . <p> " We appeal to our donors to complete power generation project to the holly site structures to attract more visitors and earn more income for self sustainability , " he said . <p> He added , " Other projects which require urgent attention are the rehabilitation of the roads leading to kayas which have remained in a dilapidated condition @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . <p> Kilifi County Deputy Governor Kenneth Kamto assured communities living adjacent to the kayas that the county was committed to supporting them in creating income generating activities like beekeeping and butterfly farming to minimise their attempts to destroy the forests .

@@7959234 <p> Batman v Superman ... Dawn of Justice had a lot of things working against it , making it a very skeptical few minutes as I sat down to the premiere of the movie on Wednesday 23rd of this month . Zack Snyder had his previous foray into the DC Universe with Superman : Man of Steel hailed as a failure , and with a fresh , unproven Batman in Ben Affleck , and the first movie appearance of Wonder Woman ( Gal Gadot ) , this ca n't have been an easy film for Warner Bros . <p> With such an important story to tell , based on the Dark Knight returns comic from 1986 , and the necessity for the shared DC Universe to be constructed in this particular film , the director decided to try and do as much of it as he could , making this one , long film . 2hrs 33 mins of running time in a superhero movie is a lot , but it is unlikely that it will happen again in the DC stories to follow , that is Justice League and Wonder Woman in 2017 , because the amount of introduction featured in this film @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ film feel slow paced , which is undesirable in what Warner Bros would like to be a blockbuster . However one introduction that is a joy to behold is that of Superman 's nemesis Lex Luthor , played by Jesse Eisenberg , in a fresh take on the age old character that was simply fantastic to see . <p> Wonder Woman/Diana Prince was also very well played by Gal Gadot , however Ben Affleck in his first film as batman was perhaps overwhelmed by the pressure , delivering a largely tepid performance , not dissimilar to the performance of Henry Cavill which lacked any emotional range whatsoever . Laurence Fishburne 's role as Perry White was also very pleasing . The effects as you would expect from a superhero action movie were also amazing , so there 's that to look forward to , with the notable appearance of all star Hans Zimmer ( Lion King , Inception , Pirates of the Caribbean franchise just to name a few ) working on the music , giving the film a great all round appearance and feel . <p> However , this @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the second film in a row . Despite all the raw ingredients , it is less than spectacular after final assembly , but I doubt it 'll stop the fans from going to see it . So if you 're not a diehard , and you just want to watch a superhero movie , have you heard of Deadpool ?

@@7977240 implementation of climate change efforts <p> Government bureaucracy has been named as one of the main deterrents in the implementation of climate change initiatives . <p> According to an expert in the climate change field , most of the money given by donors to implement community initiatives meant at reducing the impact of climate change in the grassroots ends up being spent in meetings and conferences meant to deliberate on issues relating to the funds distribution . <p> " Most of the money given by donors gets spent in meetings such that the total amount reaching the community is very little , " said Dr Joanes Atela of the African Centre for Technology Studies ( ACTS ) . <p> " I worked on a project in Western Kenya that was funded by the World Bank but out of the total amount , only 10 percent reached the community , 90 percent was lost in conferences and other things , " he narrated . <p> Speaking on the sidelines of a two-day training workshop for donors , climate change experts and policy makers that was organised by ACTS last week Wednesday , Dr Atela noted that further compounding the issue @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ government . <p> " If the sectors are not cooperating , the forestry sector will not know that there is an expert in the lands ministry who can support a particular initiative , " he noted . <p> Dr Atela further added that important decisions are made at the global level regarding climate change , but implementation of resolutions at the local level is lacking . <p> He explained that lack of understanding of those decisions and lack of resources to implement the resolutions also contribute to the lack of implementation in the country level . <p> According to Dr Atela , Kenya has few policies on climate change and more information is needed for formation of policies in the climate change area . <p> " The climate Change Bill was just passed in Parliament the other day and is now at the Senate level , it is after the Bill is enacted that we can come up with policies on climate change , " he said . <p> Speaking at the same event , Climate Change Authority Director Dr Pacifica Ogolla noted that climate change risks are real and @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and innovation to combat the global phenomenon . <p> She further added that implementation of important resolutions on climate change is key , adding that her organisation will need to work with other ministries and stakeholders to achieve this . <p> The meeting that was organised by four organisations with a focus on climate change drew experts , donors and policy makers from Kenya , Uganda , Tanzania , Rwanda and Nigeria with a view of drawing from each other 's experiences on improving policies in the climate change field , and using innovation to curb the impact of climate change .

Furthermore , Uefa has clarified that the high betting turnover for the match can be explained as the match was played on a very quiet evening of football globally . Pictures By Peter Ochieng . <p> Following the terror attack on Garissa University College that caught the attention of the world , foreign governments came in to help survivors pick up the pieces . <p> The Kenyan government only catered for the survivors ' initial medical costs at the Kenyatta National Hospital ( KNH ) and funeral expenses for the 148 killed . <p> No compensation was given , and those with serious medical complications were left to come up with other ways of raising money for their medical bills . <p> Mercy Chepkorir was shot on both legs . The shots resulted in a compound fracture on one leg and a simple fracture on the other . She stayed at KNH for two months and now uses crutches . Her single mother had to close her small business to take care of her . <p> " I am still under medication and it has strained me financially , " she says . " I used the sponsorship I received @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and I would appreciate any financial aid to help me complete my studies . " <p> Another survivor , Rachel Gikonyo , is still hospitalised due to complications from one of the seven bullets that hit her . The university catered for her treatment at the National Spinal Injury Hospital where she was bedridden , but she needed further specialised treatment in India that her family could not afford and the university could not pay for . <h> READ MORE <p> Her family languished for months , thinking of ways to come up with the initial Sh2 million needed for her treatment abroad . It was only after her mother died three days after visiting her in hospital on Christmas Day that Kenyans learnt of her double tragedy and raised money for her to go to India , where she is currently . <p> Right to compensation <p> But should innocent victims of terrorism be struggling in this manner ? <p> The Victim Protection Act 2014 covers victims of all kinds of crimes , including acts of terrorism . It states : " ... the victim has a right to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ " personal injury and costs of any medical or psychological treatment . " <p> But how does one identify the offender in terrorism cases ? <p> " It is regrettable that in Kenya we do not have any system or legal and regulatory framework for the compensation of victims of tragedies where the offender is not identifiable or capable of giving compensation , " says Kimani Githongo , an advocate of the High Court . " There is a serious gap that the government needs to look into and come up with a victims ' protection framework , especially looking at the numerous terror attacks that the country has witnessed recently , " says Githongo.

@@8046237 <h> New proposals to ... two-third gender rule <p> Kenya could finally have a mechanism to implement the two thirds gender rule by June this year . <p> Debate on the controversial issue came up in the National Assembly again last week , under the Constitution of Kenya ( amendment ) Bill moved by Majority Leader Aden Duale . <p> Duale 's proposal now seeks to ' top up ' the number of women in the National Assembly should the general election fail to meet the constitutional threshold . The proposed law introduces clauses for proportionate allocation of special seats to the number of seats won by a political party after elections . <p> It also seeks to amend various electoral laws , including the Political Parties Act , the Independent Electoral and Boundaries Commission ( IEBC ) Act , and the National Gender and Equality Commission ( NGEC ) Act , to effect Article 100 of the Constitution that seeks to promote representation of marginalised groups . <p> Besides proposing a 20-year framework within which the gender rule should be implemented , it also provides that persons nominated serve for a maximum two terms . <p> Though cautiously optimistic , women MPs remain @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ for passage of a proposal to implement the rule and avoid plunging the country into a constitutional crisis after next year 's polls . <h> READ MORE <p> The proposed legislation was seconded by chair of the parliamentary Justice and Legal Affairs committee Samuel Chepkonga , who appears to have dropped a controversial proposal he had earlier made to amend Article 81 of the Constitution to have the gender principle achieved progressively . <p> Majority of MPs in the House spoke in favour of the Bill , with the exception of Deputy Minority Leader Jakoyo Midiwo , who ran into trouble by referring to women MPs who rarely contribute to debate and those nominated to county assemblies as ' idlers ' and ' busybodies ' who squander public funds . <p> Two proposals to arrive at a mechanism to implement the gender principle are now on the cards , the other one being the Green Amendment Campaign championed by a section of the civil society . <p> The Green Amendment Campaign seeks to do away with the post-election ' gender top up ' , as happened in the county assemblies @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to Article 177 to provide for twinning of adjacent constituencies to provide 725 seats for women to be elected . <p> Special seats <p> It proposes an amendment to the Constitution as provided in Article 257 , and is already collecting the requisite one million signatures . The proposal favours the provision of special elective seats for women at both the national and county level .

@@8278232 <h> KWS receives contraband ... set to be burnt in a fortnight <p> As the country gears up for the historic torching of the largest ever consignment of contraband ivory on April 30th , containers loaded with ivory from several parts of the country started arriving at the Kenya Wildlife Service ( KWS ) headquarters Friday . <p> The containers from Voi , Mombasa , Nanyuki and other parts of the country will be received by KWS Director General Kitili Mbathi for clearance , before being transported under heavy security to Nairobi National Park . <p> The ivory will make up a significant proportion of an estimated 106 tonnes of elephant tusks to be set ablaze , in an event to be attended by several Heads of State , renowned conservationists , celebrities and other guests . <p> The event by the government is in protest at the continued slaughter of the country 's most iconic species . <p> The historic burn will be presided over by President Uhuru Kenyatta . <p> President Kenyatta will lead global actors in setting ablaze 120 tonnes of ivory and 1.5 tonnes of rhino horn to step up the fight against poaching . <p> In a statement from @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the summit will be the biggest of its kind in Africa 's history and a sign of sufficient political goodwill to collectively conserve wildlife . <p> " Poaching poses a threat to Kenya . Our wildlife , are terrorized and as a consequence , our people suffer . Both Kenya and Africa rely , in part , on our natural resources -- including our wildlife-for the economic growth and development that is a pre-requisite for peace , security and stability . Among other things , we rely on our wildlife and environment for tourism . To many in the world , Kenya is majestic animals on the Maasai Mara , Great Tuskers of Tsavo , the northern bush country of Samburu and Laikipia and the white sands of our Coast , " read the statement in part . <p> " The killing of our animals affects our ecosystems , our environment and our tourism . It affects us . Realizing the deeply detrimental impact poaching has on our country , it is incumbent on us , as Kenyans , to lead the regional and global conservation efforts , " further @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 
@@8278233 should fear when you lose your smartphone other than just how much the phone cost . Thieves are no longer stealing phones for the sake of selling them off cheaply ! ! <p> If you are unlucky to lose your phone and you did n't encounter an incident afterwards that made your heart skip out of your chest , count yourself lucky . <p> Just because you have phone tracker does n't mean someone wo n't use your phone after it gets stolen . Before they became smart , thieves used to flash stolen phones the moment they robbed their victims . <p> But these days they no longer just clear everything in your phone , they crack your codes and access your data . <p> So what are some of the things thieves do with your phone when they crack your codes ? <p> 1 . They will convince you how they have n't messed with the data in your phone and since you value the content in your phone , you will start bargaining . <p> Wonder how you ca n't track their location ? They are smart and call you with multiple numbers and talk to you for seconds when they call . Try calling them back and the number wo n't even go through . <p> 3 . Throw your sim card at crime @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ their own good . The same is true of scratch cards , they can easily be traced back to the person who used them . <p> 4 . @@8280232 <h> Hotels are employing ... tactics to get that extra coin ... <h> share <p> Owing to cutthroat competition , hotels are getting creative , employing deceptive tactics to squeeze an extra coin from unsuspecting guests . A male guest , Joshua Mung'athia , for example , went berserk after returning from a walk and was ordered to pay Sh500 , as laptop storage fee , which the hotel had apparently not told him about . <p> " I just wanted a short walk in town after sitting in a business meeting all day ? " Mung'athia told Room Service . " Walking in town with a laptop dangling on my shoulder was unwise so I left it for a while in the hotel , but little did I know they were after making some quick money from me ! " <p> But that 's not new . Most hotels use a number of meaningless adjectives to ' sex-up ' their otherwise not-so-pretty rooms . A number of star-rated hotels throw in terms such as " Deluxe " and " Superior " just to justify charging an extra thousand . <p> A bemused guest once confronted a room attendant , " Just explain to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ . " The reply : " A Deluxe has a large mirror in the toilet , sizeable windows and also comes with a better toilet flushing handle ! " <p> And the smart marketing language continues to the dining arena . Food is referred to as " gourmet , " " culinary delight " or " artisanal " yet after tasting , most are tasteless , lousily-made food heavily laced with cheap spices to camouflage mediocrity . <p> But the mother of them all is " Ocean view " . Again , sometimes it 's accurate , but how on earth do you get an ocean view from a room on 9th floor overlooking busy Kenyatta Avenue , Nairobi ? These folks must either be magicians or have unimaginably powerful binoculars . I mean , the nearest ocean , that of India , is 500kms away . <p> Another dirty trick from the book is to promise guests free Wi-Fi , but fail to mention that it is only available at the swimming pool between 5-6pm , yet the pool closes at 6pm and the rest of the hotel is @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Michael Ruff wrote on Tripadviser . " I once stayed at a five-star resort in Mombasa , where the " free " Wi-Fi was only available on one particular seat in the lobby during a one hour window every afternoon ! " <p> I know it 's weird , but " all-inclusive " used to mean : food , booze , swimming , band entertainment and access to every restaurant on the property . But smart hotels have amended that old age comprehensive offer . Now , almost every " all-inclusive " hotel has disclaimer in fine prints on check-in receipts ! <p> That 's how a guest who frequents a hotel along Valley Road ended up paying exorbitantly for a glass of lukewarm water with slender slices of lemon ! <p> " I thought the cashier had gone nuts when she presented that bill . How can such a prestigious hotel charge me Sh500 for boiled tap water with slices of lemon that goes for 10 shillings ? That 's plain robbery , " cried the guest . But the hotel manager was adamant : " We are not @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ lemon you took sir , but for exemplary service of our welcoming waitress , her infectious smile and for the unique environment and breathtaking d ? cor , " the GM curtly but politely replied . <p> He explained : " We do this to encourage many idle ' guests ' in town who just pop in to our hotel just because it is in the middle of the city pretending they are serious guests here for power lunch . " And then the final act in the book of hoteliers is based on location . Because hotels near town charge higher premium crafty hotels advertise themselves as city hotels ! 
@@8280233 <h> Just A band ... hiatus <h> share <p> It 's time to say goodbye . Last week saw their final performance for the next two years as a globally sensational trio during Blankets &amp; Wine . Ngare Mukiria tells the story of Just A band like never before <p> It 's hard to place one word to start describing the visionary genius that this special network of creatives have come to manifest . Nonetheless , avant-garde may spring to mind when observing the context of both the African and International scope . Together they have brought innovative expressions to nearly every approach of disco , afro -electronic and even rap . <p> What may have set them apart is their ability to eloquently capture raw , fresh and old addictions in a sociably enjoyable way . Not to mention their unique and evolving efforts in visual storytelling , which helped catapult their music all the way to globally recognised platforms . <p> Just a band finally announced their two year break and bid their farewell at the Blankets &amp; Wine festival last Sunday . Before they did though , they left us with their priceless memoir published into a picture book wittingly titled @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ been the Blinky Bill ( Bill selanga ) , Nairobi Dhobi ( Daniel Muli ) and Dj Ricky Suede ( Mbithi Masya ) . <p> Jim chuchu who also deeply contributed to their success left to pursue solo projects in film and music . Though they met during their studies at Kenyatta University , they all had amazingly rich pasts that reveal the origins of their eclectic sound . <p> As told in their book , Nairobi Dhobi is a migrant and designate of a Nubian brotherhood . He ended up studying Fine Arts having already learnt how to play the Misenkora ( a six stringed desert lyre ) whilst on his travels with a touareg caravan . Blinky Bill went on to study Sports Science where he began his artistic ambitions on the guitar managing to be a constant addition in local bands such as Digibell Kudamm and Conga -- O-Matik . <p> Jim 's history spans all the way to Kilgoris town of Narok County where he was a waiter . Here , he studied sound synthesis under the mentorship of Daoussa Debu . The rest became history @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Volkswagen van for some instruments . <p> Iwinyo Piny ' emerged as their first , well appreciated audiovisual achievement in 2008 which reflected their interests in house and trance music . By then , a conscious effort to mix disco-orientated music with some local identity was increasing visibly . This became part of their first studio album Scratch to Reveal that also featured exciting hits such as Hey ! That quickly made them a favourite to many at live concerts and fests within and outside the city . <p> Two years later comes Kenya 's first viral meme Makmende , a fictional 70 's styled action hero with a quest for vengeance . The music video of which Makmende plays a central character sky rocketed Ha-he , a single from the album 82 which failed to disappoint with even more successful hits such as Tingiza Kichwa and Usinibore . <p> The 15 track Sorry for the Delay album later came through as the most dynamical , with even further and high quality innovations . By this time , Jim 's large shoes had been filled by Mbithi Masya who had @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ being produced with the likes of Stan , Lisa Oduor and Octopizzo . Singles like Probably for Lovers and Dunia Ina Mambo proved their growth in pop lyricism and alternative compositions with the appearance of horn sections and more masterful instrumental performances on voice , bass and guitar . <p> Local directors , photographers , graphic designers , actors , dancers and stylists as part of JAB 's collective helped breathe this movement to life ever since the label revolution that they co-formed during their genesis . Despite their thrillingly awaited fourth studio album that teased us with Winning in Life , the band attached a CD with their book titled Light Speed that contains their previously unreleased music . <p> As they invite some time to re-settle and re-discover themselves through their growing solo projects , their legacy promises to push further boundaries and distill powerful energy into the hearts of many across the globe .

@@8344234 <h> Weak laws stimulating ... trade in Kenya <h> share <p> Recently , French MPs passed a law that makes it illegal to pay for sex and imposes fines of up to Sh400,000 for those buying sexual acts . <p> Those convicted would also have to attend classes to learn about the conditions faced by prostitutes . Those found guilty for paying for sex will pay a first time fine of Sh165,000 , which will more than double for a repeat offence . The move , unpopular as it was among sex-hungry men and women as well as sex workers , offers lessons for many countries grappling with the growing prostitution problem . <p> As expected , sex workers protested the law . It will of course kill their business , but it will also help fight trafficking networks and restore some level of moral purity . France had tried to fight prostitution way back in 2003 when it passed a law that penalised sex workers for soliciting but that did not slow down the trade . <p> In Kenya , sex business has become as big as even tourism . Every single day Kenyans -- mostly men from low-earners in the slums and @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ sex in whatever form . Nairobi and other big towns are full of brothels which remain busy even during economic slowdown . <p> With technology , prostitution has gone high-end and sex workers are getting clients through Facebook and WhatsApp , where the daring ones have created their own groups . It 's not unusual , by the way , to see female purveyors of flesh posting their ' sexy ' photos on Facebook , including their phone numbers to solicit partakers . <p> Sex trade remains illegal in Kenya . But the enforcement of the law has been as weak as the many hearts of men who oil this business . Sometime back the police would conduct swoops but that stopped when it was discovered that the officers would also ask for sexual favours to release the culprits , thus promoting the business rather than curtailing it . <p> Perhaps Kenya should go the France way to reduce prostitution since it appears impossible to eliminate what 's often referred to be the world 's oldest profession . Sex trade creates a fertile ground for crimes such as sexual abuse @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , thievery and immoral acts like adultery , pre-marital sex and so on . <p> Sweden , which was the first country to criminalise those who pay for sex rather than the prostitutes , is reaping the fruits . Swedish authorities say the number of women on the streets in the prostitution area in Stockholm has fallen since the legislation was introduced . <p> If that happens in Kenya , the men and women who buy sex can channel the billions into improving their families and more productive investments . <p> The writer is the managing editor of businesstoday.co.ke Twitter @mulunda email : email protected

@@8350230 <p> This year Peru ... n't be able to export grapes , peaches , watermelon , lemon ( subtle and tahit ? ) , orange , tangelo , tangerine , grapefruit , giant white corn , sweet corn , and purple corn to Ecuador . This was a decision taken by the Ecuadorian Agency for Agricultural Quality Assurance ( Agrocalidad ) , an entity that is part of the Ministry of Agriculture , Fisheries , Livestock and Aquaculture and Fisheries ( Magap ) . <p> Diego Vizcaino , the executive director of Agrocalidad , said that this agency had suspended the issuance of phytosanitary import permits for these products since April 13 because they had found quarantine pests in shipments of said products . <p> Agrocalidad reported the ban to the Peruvian National Service of Agrarian Health Agency ( Senasa ) on April 13 . <p> The aforementioned products may not enter Ecuador , just like Peruvian red onions and apples which have been banned since 2014 . The measure , which took effect last Wednesday , does not include the Peruvian cargo that had received phytosanitary permits prior to the ban and that were already being transported to the country . <p> According @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to safeguard the agricultural activity in the country : " Ecuador is not affected by the insects ( pests ) found in Peruvian loads , therefore , they pose a threat to agriculture " . <p> Three weeks ago Agrocalidad also implemented a similar measure on citrus from Colombia ; however , this country has reached agreements to certify that their fruit producing sites are free from the yellow dragon , said the official . <p> To date , Peru 's National Service of Agrarian Health ( Senasa ) of Peru , has n't pronounced itself against the measure so Vizcaino believes that there wo n't be any trade retaliations . <p> Regarding a possible rise in smuggling of these products , Vizcaino said that this measure could probably cause these products to be smuggled into the country . According to the official , these foods were not imported in large quantities nor were they seasonal . Agrocalidad will continue performing controls at border crossings , ports , airports , and destination points to prevent the entry of food that could pose a health risk in the country . <p> @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , citrus , watermelon , grapes , and corn from Peru . In 2014 , before the ban that is still enforced , Ecuador imported a total of 66,294 tons of red onion . 
@@8350231 <p> More than 200 ... and development partners and experts met at the International Institute of Tropical Agriculture ( IITA ) last week in Ibadan , to unveil an initiative that will transform agriculture on the continent and ensure that Africa is able to feed itself through agriculture . <p> Discussions at the three-day workshop were on a new initiative known as ? Africa Feeding Africa ? or the Technologies for African Agricultural Transformation ( TAAT ) programme . <p> According to the organisers , the major goal of the TAAT Programme is to eliminate extreme poverty , end hunger and malnutrition , achieve food sufficiency , and turn Africa into a net food exporter as well as set Africa in line with global commodity and agricultural value chains . It also plans to adopt modernised , commercial agriculture as the key to transforming Africa and the livelihoods of its people , particularly the rural poor . <p> The Forum for Agricultural Research in Africa ( FARA ) and the CGIAR Consortium and 12 of its 15 international agricultural centres active in Africa support this initiative by the Bank and the co-sponsors to revitalise and transform agriculture through the TAAT programme within the shortest @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the ecosystems that underpin agriculture . The workshop was organised by IITA in partnership with the Support to Agricultural Research for Development of Strategic Crops ( SARD-SC ) project for the African Development Bank , which is funding this mega initiative . <p> The initiative was led by IITA , FARA , CGIAR , national agricultural research systems , and the Alliance for a Green Revolution in Africa ( AGRA ) . This will involve close partnerships among AfDB , the World Bank , and major development partners to ensure increased funding for agricultural research and development along the value chains in Africa . CGIAR , FARA , AVRDC ? The World Vegetable Centre , Africa Harvest , and other partners provide the technical and developmental support for the bank ? s quest of widespread agricultural transformation . <p> To date , about 22 African countries have been identified as potential partners with the CGIAR centres in the planning , content , and evaluation of investments in agricultural transformation . This workshop gives an opportunity for more Regional Membership Countries ( RMCs ) of AfDB to join in this effort @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 
@@8350232 <p> Besides supporting the ... Cross , the Red Cross Blossom Walk also launched the start of the new Dutch strawberry season this year . The start and finish locations were completely strawberry themed . The 28,040 walkers could feast on fresh strawberries after the walk . In addition , food blogger Francesca inspired the walkers with delicious strawberry dishes . Strawberry growers sold 20,000 punnets of Dutch strawberries to the participants to enjoy at home . <p> The season has opened again <p> ? Fruitmasters is looking back at a successful opening of the new Dutch strawberry season during the 24th edition of the Red Cross Blossom Walk . Strawberries were very eye-catching at our premises . The participants enjoyed plenty of fresh Dutch strawberries . Furthermore , food blogger Francesca provided much inspiration . She had drawn up several recipes , which participants sampled enthusiastically . We made a huge effort to let consumers know that the new Dutch strawberry season has opened again , and that they are on plenty of shelves again . We hope the walkers had a beautiful day and that they came to like the Dutch strawberries , ? Leonard Kampsch ? er , commercial manager of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Fruitmasters opened its premises as starting and finishing points for the Red Cross Blossom Walk for the 24th time . Besides walking through beautiful blossom orchards , the walk is about sportsmanship , solidarity and looking out for people who could use some attention and help . The Royal Netherlands Army built bridges across the river the Linge and private properties were opened especially for this day , so that walkers get to go places that are usually not opened to the public . <p> First blackberries <p> On Friday 15 April Fruitmasters auctioned off the first blackberries of the season under quality label Prestige . These blackberries of the strain Loch Tay were offered on the auction of Fruitmasters in Geldermalsen by cultivator Pippel Bramen from Haaften . The twelve punnets of 150 gram were bought by Fruitmasters Holland at ? 9. - per punnet . This brought the total profit of the first punnets to ? 108. - . This profit will go to Stichting Glaucoomfonds ( Foundation Glaucoma Fund ) . <p> Henk van Oosteren ( l ) and Patrick Claassen ( r ) with the first @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ chronic eye disorder , which causes damage to the optic nerve if untreated . The Stichting Glaucoomfonds has as goal improving ophthalmic science and care . The foundation is in particular focusing on preventing visual infirmity and blindness through glaucoma . The foundation also councils on the chronic eye disorder . 
@@8350233 <p> The Tanimura Family ... on Sunday the loss of their family patriarch and agricultural legend George Tanimura at his home in Salinas on April 15 . George was born in San Juan Bautista on July 2 , 1915 to Eijiro Kimoto and Yukino Tanimura . <p> In 1948 , the Tanimura Family began a farming relationship with another agricultural legend , Bud Antle . Shortly thereafter , the Tanimuras began to grow exclusively for Bud Antle , Inc . Bud , and his son Bob Antle , began working closely with the Tanimura family for over 34 years . In 1982 this relationship culminated in the formation of Tanimura &amp; Antle . George along with his brothers , Charlie , Johnny , Tommy and Bobby , and nephews , Gary and Keith formed Tanimura &amp; Antle with Bob Antle and his sons Rick and Mike . This partnership joined the Tanimura growing expertise with the Antle packing , marketing , and shipping expertise . George and Bob Antle became inseparable partners and Co-Chairmen of the Board as they worked together to successfully lead Tanimura &amp; Antle to become the premier agriculture company in the world . <p> In July 2014 , George celebrated @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ birthday celebration with family , business partners and friends . Over 600 people joined together to honor and respect the highly regarded Salinas family farmer . In July 2015 , he quietly celebrated his actual 100th birthday surrounded by his wonderful family eating his favorite Saba sushi . 
@@8350234 <p> Demand for blueberries ... growing in China . Imports have jumped and local production is being boosted . Improved knowledge of the industry and available capital in the fresh produce industry has lead to a number of new blueberry plantations . Nanjiang Tian Guo Agricultural Science and Technology launched in 2015 only and is upscaling production at a fast pace . <p> ? We have 270 hectares with blueberries near Nanjing . Annually we produce 800 tons of blueberries . Our harvest season starts in May and runs until the end of August . Most of our crop we sell on the Chinese domestic market . We have a logistics team that is dedicated to daily fresh delivery . The fruit we pick is delivered the same day . We have a cold storage facility of 1,500 square meters which has automatic cleaning and sterilising facilities . We can process 100 tons here . In addition , we can freeze up to 450 tons of fruit , ? says Liang Guangzhi , the general manager of Nanjiang Tian Guo Agricultural . <p> " The company was launched in 2015 with an investment of 9 million Yuan ( equal to 1.2 million Euro ) @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ raspberries . " <p> ? We deliver to big cities , including Hong Kong , Beijing , Shanghai and Guangzhou . Currently , we have a second factory under construction which we hope to complete later this season . When the season starts in May it will take up most of our time and capacity . After that , we want to start to explore international markets . 
@@8350235 <p> Over the past ... years , Poland 's tomato production has showed a clear upward trend , growing from approximately 681 thousand tonnes on average between 2006 and 2008 to 803 thousand tonnes between 2013 and 2015 ( +18% ) , as reported by Anna Kitala , expert agricultural market analyst at BGZ BNP Paribas . <p> " The growth of Poland 's domestic tomato production during the period at hand has been supported by a rising export demand . According to Eurostat data , the volume of Polish tomato exports over the past decade has increased by 27 percent , from 80 thousand tonnes on average between 2006 and 2008 to 101 thousand tonnes between 2013 and 2015 . <p> Interestingly , while the EU countries have remained an important destination , their share decreased steadily , from 90 percent in 2006 to 53 percent in 2010 . From 2011 onwards , Polish tomatoes were shipped mostly to non-EU countries , mainly due to Russia 's purchases , which grew from 3 thousand tonnes in 2006 to 51 thousand tonnes in 2013 . This situation changed with the introduction of the Russian embargo , which came into effect from August 2014 . @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Polish tomatoes were exported again to EU countries , " explains Anna Kitala . <p> She stressed that the import of tomatoes into Polish territory has also showed an upward trend in the last decade , increasing from 86 thousand tonnes on average between 2006 and 2008 to 144 thousand tonnes between 2013 and 2015 ( Eurostat ) . <p> " If we compare the volume of imports and exports , it turns out that Poland imports more tomatoes than it exports , and what 's more , the gap between imports and exports is getting wider . Poland 's largest tomato supplier is Spain , although its share in the Polish market has been declining . " <p> On average , Spanish tomatoes had a share of approximately 57 percent between 2006 and 2008 , but between 2013 and 2015 this figure dropped to 40 percent . " Meanwhile , imports from the Netherlands recorded a slight growth , from 19 percent to 24 percent , and German tomatoes also gained ground in the Polish market , going from 8 to 13 percent , " she added . <p> @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ over the past decade . According to the Central Statistical Office , an average of approximately 10.12 kilos per person per year were consumed between 2006 and 2008 , while in the period between 2012 and 2014 this figure stood at 9.88 kilos per person . 
@@8350237 <h> Pages <p> All ... relating to betting and gambling have been declared unsuitable for airing between 5am and 10pm . <p> But the Kenya Film Classification Board said this will not apply to commercials relating to government lotteries and contests . <p> Chairman Ezekiel Mutua further said all advertisements for alcoholic drinks and those with sexually suggestive scenes are unsuitable for the watershed period ( 5am and 10pm ) . <p> Mutua said all billboards with sexual innuendos and statements such as " lasts longer than your boyfriend " should be pulled down in 14 days . <p> The chairman said all commercials or public service announcements for condoms and other contraceptives will also be classified as unsuitable for the period unless they contain a public health safety message . <p> He said the guidelines will be revised from time to time . <p> Others are : <p> 1 . Advertisements shall not contain visuals or messages that constitute a breach of applicable laws . They should not appear to condone or promote any illegal activity . <p> 2 . Commercials shall not contain statements or suggestions that may offend the sensibilities of any racial or religious group , and shall not in @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ flippant frivolous or inaccurate manner . <p> 4 . Commercials using derogative language or propaganda for war or advocating for hatred on any identifiable group characteristic , not allowed . <p> 5 . Advertisements shall not contain any images , symbols or figures likely to be considered gratuitously offensive nor should they be demeaning to gender , race , culture or tribe . <p> 6 . Programmes likely to be seen by children should not contain any visuals , effects or words that might result in harm to them morally or psychologically . <p> 7 . Advertisements that feature children should be carefully considered from the point of view of safety of children and should not show them any acts that might endanger them or others . <p> 8 . Advertisements shall maintain good taste in visuals and language , devoid of sexually lewd , graphic or indecent language and images that are explicit in nature . <p> 9 . All commercials for alcoholic drinks shall be classified as unsuitable for watershed periods . Alcoholic commercials that seek to glamorise abuse or misuse of alcohol-related products , and attempt to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ successful lifestyle , shall be restricted . <p> 10 . Commercials demeaning political figures and party manifestos using derogative language , inciting stereotyping that contains propaganda for war or incitement

@@8350240 <h> Rugby Rugby <h> ... Kenya 7s returns to a heroic reception <p> The victorious Kenya Sevens team when they returned home from Singapore 7s where they lifted their first ever Main Cup title.PHOTO/Timothy Olobulu <p> NAIROBI , April 19 -- The victorious Kenya Sevens team returned home to a heroic welcome on Tuesday afternoon after displaying a milestone performance at the eighth round of the HSBC Sevens World Series where they lifted their first ever Main Cup in Singapore over the weekend . <p> The team that was led by skipper Andrew Amonde and the man of the tournament Collins Injera touched down at 2:15pm to bring the busy Jomo Kenyatta International Airport to a standstill as Cabinet Secretary for Sports Arts and Culture Dr Hassan Wario led government officials , relatives and friends to receive the team . <p> Speaking upon arrival , an ecstatic Injera , who grounded his 225th career try to close on world leading record holder Argentine Gomez Cora said it was a dream come true after featuring for the national team for nine years . <p> " Winning this Cup feels awesome . I have been in this game for almost a decade and lifting the trophy @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ as a team . During the semi finals , I proposed to take the penalty because I had a feeling and knew well it was the only chance that could take us to the final , " Injera , who is the Shujaa vice captain asserted . <p> He added , " We will rest and enjoy the moment . Recovery will be important then we go back to training and try and work on things that did not work for us in the last two tournaments . " <p> His elder brother veteran Humphrey Kayange stated , " It feels nice to become a champion after attempting for a long time . We believed in our ability and our defence worked for us in the last two tournaments . " <p> Wario promised to reward the team that defied the odds to upset Singapore and overall World Series champions Fiji 30-7 in the pulsating final . <p> " This is the day you feel proud to be Kenyan , beating the world is not something easy . A few years we thought rugby was gone but it has come @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ boys and we welcome them home . We will sit down with them together with their administration and look at how we can help them going forward , " Wario declared . <p> Kenya 7s captain Andrew Amonde lifting the trophy when the team arrived home on April 19 from Singapore.PHOTO/Timothy Olobulu <p> The team 's convoy proceeded to a Nairobi hotel where they were hosted to a luncheon by title sponsors Kenya Airways . <p> Kenya is ranked seventh in the log on 85 points , ahead of traditional heavyweights including England and France , serving notice of their intentions for Rio Olympic Games where they will be one of the medal contenders . <p> They will take a 10 day rest before returning to training to prepare for the last two rounds in Paris and London . <p> In Paris , Kenya has been drawn in a relatively fair Pool A alongside titans New Zealand , Portugal and Russia .

@@8351237 tax collection to cut deficit <p> Kenya , whose budget deficit this fiscal year unnerved investors , is recruiting new taxpayers and investing in technology to boost collections , the head of its tax agency said on Tuesday . <p> In a bid to reassure investors , East Africa 's biggest economy aims to cut the deficit to 6.9 percent of gross domestic product in the fiscal year starting in July , from a forecast 8.1 percent for 2015/16 . <p> Kenya 's tax collection stands at about 19 to 20 percent of GDP , more than many African states but well below those of emerging markets like South Africa , where it is 26 percent . <p> Kenya Revenue Authority Commissioner General John Njiraini told a news conference the authority was reviewing income tax laws to make them simpler and to enhance collections . <p> " We are fairly confident that going forward , in the next two to three years , we should be seeing tax to GDP ratio bounce back to the levels that the government has set itself , " he said . <p> He did not give a specific figure , but the government @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ markets like South Africa , rather than fellow frontier markets . <p> KRA was also developing technology , such as a mobile phone application , which would allow users to check if consumer goods were tax compliant before they bought them , Njiraini said . <p> Illicit bottled water and juices were estimated to account for about 60 percent of the revenues lost through non-tax compliant sales , denying revenue to the tax authority and licensed manufacturers . <p> KRA recorded an increase in revenue of 11.7 percent in the nine months to March - the first three quarters of the 2015/16 fiscal year - falling short of a target of 20.9 percent . <p> Njiraini attributed the slower growth to delayed passage of related legislation and a weak business environment . <p> Banks , a major sector of the economy , have seen profit growth slow and bad loans rise . <p> The Finance Ministry is cutting spending by ministries in the fiscal year to June as a result of slower rise in revenue collection than expected . <p> Thank you for participating in discussions on The Star , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ defamatory statements will be deleted . <p> Strong personal criticism is acceptable if justified by facts and arguments .

HIV and Aids monitoring report indicates that 73 percent of people living with the virus face open discrimination from their local communities with the slum areas being the major perpetrators . Photo/linkedin.com <p> The Kenyan government in conjunction with World Health Organisation has been in the forefront in ensuring HIV and Aids victims get accommodated into their societies with no or little discrimination . <p> Unfortunately , this vulnerable group is still living with physical and emotional stigma with the slums being most hit by the vice . A recent survey conducted by the Ministry of Health revealed that women suffering from the viral disease are the most sidelined by their local communities , heightening the state of psychological instability . <p> The government has gone to the extent of offering free anti-retroviral drugs and even giving occasional stipends to ease the side hustles these people go through but the society still perpetuates mental torture to HIV patients . <p> In the 2016 HIV and Aids monitor report , 73 percent of people living with the virus were reported to be facing discrimination from their community . I have never experienced any bad customer relationship , " Wawira said . <p> The Salon Manager in Nairobi , however , says she was really inconvenienced when the bank went under . <p> " Banking with them again will be tricky , " she explained when asked whether she will remain in the bank once it reopens . <p> However , John Seno , co-founder @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ seems to have a deeper relationship with the bank . <p> " I have been with the bank since August last year . I opened two business accounts and one personal account . The customer service was amazing and it 's not just that the women are pretty which everyone emphasizes , they actually attend to you with a smile and are very responsive , " Seno explains the relationship , adding that : " Once , the branch manager even helped me process a transaction and they actually remembered my name . " <p> He says if Chase Bank came back as a subsidiary of KCB with better corporate governance structures he would still bank with them . <p> " I 'm one of the 3 percent of depositors with more than Sh1 million so I have significant exposure . I look forward to the reopening . Finally , it looks like a strong domestic institution will be taking over Chase bank and that creates confidence in the market , " he stated . <p> Another depositor , Jane Mukami , says she will not rush to withdraw her funds when the bank reopens under KCB . <p> " But I will not make deposits as yet until the situation stabilizes . At least we are seeing efforts to salvage the bank , and the fact that a big bank like KCB has taken over is good news for depositors , " adds Mukami . <p> The regulator endorsed an agreement with KCB yesterday morning at 8.30am that essentially agreed Chase Bank 's management and operations will be taken over by KCB and open for business on Wednesday next week . <p> This is the first time a bank in receivership has been reopened . For as much as this day has become a national celebration , it is also very much a family event too . After all , Elizabeth is a proud great-grandmother five times over . <p> The Queen is seen for the first time cuddling the youngest of her family , 11-month-old Princess Charlotte , in the picture which was taken just after Easter in the Green Drawing Room at Windsor . <p> Cheeky little Mia Tindall can be seen proudly holding up her great-granny 's ? 1,000 @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ there , that was totally unscripted . <p> " The moment with Mia was completely spontaneous , it was not staged at all . She just picked up her great-granny 's handbag and that was it , " they said . <p> It was , they revealed , a " happy , chaotic , warm afternoon ' with the parents of the children all present and trying to catch their offspring 's eye . <p> " Taking pictures of children is like herding cats but for that split second , it just worked . Annie Leibovitz has children of her own and knows her stuff . " <p> The group portrait is one of three released today , the other two being of the Queen and her beloved dogs , and a rare and surprisingly warm shot of the Queen with her daughter Princess Anne . <p> " There was a very definite idea behind the set , " said a royal aide . " The Queen wanted a portrait of the youngest members of the family , the other end of the generational spectrum .
